intro: Selaginella pansamalensis, commonly known as the Panamá spike moss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the humid, shaded environments of tropical forests. This plant exhibits a unique life cycle that includes both a gametophytic and sporophytic phase, typical of bryophytes. Its morphology features a slender, creeping stem with small, scale-like leaves. Selaginella pansamalensis plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
